meanings.definition: Cells in the retina that respond to light and trigger nerve impulses.
meanings.sent1: The photoreceptors in the eye help us see in the dark.
meanings.sent2: The doctor studied the photoreceptors in the retina to understand vision better.
meanings.sent3: The photoreceptors in the eye had a party when the lights went out.
meanings.sent4: Her curiosity was like photoreceptors, always seeking out new information.
meanings.sent5: The photoreceptors danced with joy as the sun rose, signaling the start of a new day.

meanings.definition: A type of sensory receptor that responds to light.
meanings.sent1: The photoreceptors in the skin help us feel sunlight.
meanings.sent2: Animals with sensitive photoreceptors can see in low light conditions.
meanings.sent3: The photoreceptors in the camera were jealous of the spotlight.
meanings.sent4: His intuition acted like photoreceptors, guiding him towards the truth.
meanings.sent5: The photoreceptors in the flower petals attracted bees with their vibrant colors.
